resources.string: An application profile defines a set of metadata descriptors that will be used to document your data. Please select one from the device to pair with this folder.
Please provide the name of the folder (required)

Labtablet can continuously monitor the gps coordinates and store them in a standard format. After turning off this option, a KML file will be generated and can be included in the favorite metadata records.
Please provide a description for your dataset (optional).
Pairing LabTablet with the repository will allow you to collect metadata, and upload it to the repository where your dataset is stored.
The following list shows the current file formats that can be generated by LabTablet and their correspondent descriptors. To define an association edit an existing one, click on the item.
A commonly used method of lossy compression for digital images, particularly for those images produced by digital photography. LabTablet uses this format to store photos and pictures.
An encoding format for digital audio which uses a form of lossy data compression. This format is used to save the voice recordings.
Keyhole Markup Language - an XML notation for expressing geographic annotation and visualization within Internet-based, two-dimensional maps and three-dimensional Earth browsers
Base configuration not found. Please select an application profile from the home screen.
LabTablet is now uploading data to the repository and this can take some time. Please stand by.

After this process, the gathered metadata will be available at your repository and associated with the data inside the folder. This favorite will no longer be available for edition after this process is completed.

Uploading metadata to the repository will associate it with the previously created folder and its contents. Before proceeding to the upload, make sure you have enough battery life and that your device has an active internet connection.

Check internet connectivity and battery level

Validate metadata records to submit.

Proceed to the upload stage.
The project root is reserved. Please select another folder, or create a new one.
This is already the root of the project
Are you sure you want to delete this favorite. After this step, all the enclosed (meta)data will be permanently lost.
You have no active projects. To create a new one and start collecting metadata, press the button below

Projects can be seen as folders in which all the recorded data and metadata will be stored. A project can hold an unlimited set of resources concerning an experimental run, a field trip or any other activity. At this stage, we only need a name and an optional description. Both can be edited at any time.
No application profile was found. Please start by loading a profile in the configurations menu
Great! You have no generic descriptors associated with your datasets!
You have %1$d generic descriptor(s) in use. Although they may be a quick answer to specifying the context, generic descriptors are bad for your dataset as they provide no context for the metadata.
The application profile is already loaded
This is a file. It cannot be selected
Are you sure you want to quit the submission stage? You can launch the favorite upload at any time.
There are no recommended descriptors for this metadata
Are you sure you want to close the application?
Collect metadata from the available sensors and take notes about the research
Easily manage opened projects and metadata
Upload metadata to the repository and make it available to your team
This folder is empty. You can still deposit your metadata here.
The GPS is currently being monitored, please stop this task before proceeding
Please stop the recorder before proceeding
Below are the configurations that will be used to access your Dendro personal area. You will need these configurations when uploading your records to the repository.
The Dendro configurations (username, password and server location) are yet to be provided. Please do so by opening the configurations menu.
There are no Dendro suggested descriptors. Please select one from the other provided categories.
The available sensors are listed below. Once you tap a sensor, LabTablet will store a sample of its value to later associate with a context.
If you specify the name of the project, additional descriptors will be suggested depending on your usage. You can change the associated project at any time.
This field specifies the folder to store the metadata records collected in this project. It is not required that this folder exists in the repository.
There is at least one record without an associated descriptor.
The destination folder is not defined yet. Please select it in the previous step
Your device\'s GPS is turned off. Do you like to turn it back on?
Please provide the new value for this record. All the associated metadata will be migrated to match the given name.
After accepting the migration, this file will be included in the dataset and visible ouside the metadata folder.
Please stand by, while LabTablet is updating your favorite.
Failed to import resource to this favorite. Please try again.
There is no application to open this kind of files.
These are the questions associated with this form. You can edit them or add new ones.
There are no items associated with this form. To add a new one, tap the button below.
This form already exists in your list. Please provide a different name
Below is the metadata gathered during this session. Select which records you want to keep and confirm the best descriptor.
Write below the text for this question
Now, choose below the expected type of answer
Select the range to restrict the answer
Add the allowed values to the list below
OK! Your question was created! Tap the button below to add it to the form and conclude this process. If you wish, you can specify the expected time for the user to answer this question.
Q: Before you start… \n Would you like to provide a description for this form?
Select the form to fill from the list bellow
You are about to start a questionnaire that is estimated to take some minutes. Tap the button below to start.
There is at least one unanswered question that is mandatory.
Unable to load folders. Try again?
If you want to include any description for this resource, please write it down below. This will appear along the imported file.
Tap here to choose a descriptor from the available set.
Access to location services is disabled. Please enable them first
A name identifier must be provided

Your profile is already loaded, but you can change it through the configurations area. A profile is usually built together with an information specialist that has deep knowledge about your domain. if you find the loaded profile too limited or, in some way, inappropriate for your work, contact either the developer or your supervisor.

The application profile is not yet loaded. In order to proceed with creating and managing projects you must first select one to import. A profile contains elements that are later associated with each of your descriptions to give them meaning within the context of your project. It is usually built in collaboration with a curator - an information specialist - responsible for identifying important indicators for projects from your domain. If you happen to need the profile, please speak with either the developer or your supervisor.
Cannot turn on voice recognition while recording
Do you really want to quit?
There are unsaved changes that will be lost if you leave this screen.
This will erase all voice recognition custom configurations.
Do you want to save the defined keywords for current language before change it?

Hands free mode allows you to give voice commands in field mode. You can see the saved keywords for each button by long pressing it. Visit Speech recogn. area on the menu to customize your keywords. Speech recognition is not available for every button. You can save a descriptor\'s value by saying the descriptor\'s keyword. You can also dictate notes\' text and descriptors\' values. In offline mode you can only collect by voice sensors\' samples, initiate voice recording and save position (keywords not customizable).
I am sorry but I did not understand what you said. Please repeat it.
That descriptor does not exist. Please choose another.
You have lost network connection. Shutting down google speech recognition and turning on offline speech recognition (limited)
You have network connection. You can use google speech recognition
There are no items in this section. Tap below to import or create resources
There are no items.\nAdd new ones by pressing the button below

Dictionaries are sets of frequently used terms that can assist you when filling out some descriptions throughout the project. They can be, for instance, a list of your collaborators\' full names, or a list of species that are frequently seen.
Do you wish to import this favorite to your list?
Unable to import this project. Please contact the supervisor.
Exporting data to the SeaBioData repositories requires a set of credentials to be provided. This will authenticate your submissions.
All your submissions will have an associated campaign. You can define it here (a set of valid credentials are required to list the available campaigns).
This can help you choosing collaborators to associate whenever necessary

These are the procedures identified by the campaign administrator. They can be used to ease the task of filling out the forms, where applicable. Should you wish to add a new procedure please contact the campaign administrator.
Please authenticate the credentials above and try again.
The users list is not available. You can import it from the configurations menu.
Specify this questions header (variables to read from the user\'s input)
The available vocabularies were not loaded. You can do it in the configurations menu.
Select an option for the context to provide
To export your records you need to provide your credentials in the configuration menu. Please do so, and try again afterwards.

SeaBioData resources are necessary for specific, controlled vocabularies across the application. They are pre-configured in the SeaBioData repository by a campaign administrator and then imported into this application.
The records were successfuly exported to the device\'s storage.
Use the buttons bellow to assist you with the form
resources.string-array:
Describing data | When exploring research data, having access to information regarding their production circumstances is of utmost importance. While basic datasets are easily understood without such information, the same doesn\'t happen if we consider modern research workflows. To overcome this barrier, it is advisable to provide information that can help third parties fully understand how these datasets were produced, which research institutions were involved along with other relevant aspects. \n\n With an improved data description, we can achieve higher reuse rates, higher chances of data being preserved on the long run, and create mechanisms that help validating published research.
LabTablet | In some cases, researchers are already describing their data in a systematic approach, even without noticing it. They often resort to paper-based laboratory notebooks to do so which, as you can understand, can be a frail support for such an important asset. LabTablet is designed to quickly gather important insights about research data. It is similar to an electronic laboratory notebook, offering diverse digital support for all kinds of descriptions. Text-based notes can be a good starting point, but LabTablet can use the integrated sensors to automatically record the available information.
Taking advantage of built-in sensors |
LabTablet can read the device\'s built-in sensors, provided you find them useful. The available sources are entirely dependent on the platform, but it is quite common to find devices with:\n • GPS
\n • Temperature
\n • Luminosity
\n • Magnetic field
\n • Other proprietary sensors
For quick memos, for instance, you can make short voice recordings that you can later translate into other formats. This feature can also be used if you look forward to record an interview or any other event that you feel should be kept. With this in mind, LabTablet lets you record from these sources:" + " • Voice
" + " • Video
" + " • Depictions or photos
" + " • Sketches
" + "
As soon as you finish the field session, the correspondent files are stored locally in appropriate formats. //
Yes/No //MC{Y,N}
Closed Vocabulary //MC{a,b,c}
Range //MC{1-3}
